availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William W. Howard (Nicholas County, KY, clerk and notary public)

body.p: Nicholas County, Kentucky, clerk and notary public. Kentucky native. Son of Joel Howard and Margaret C. Howard. Married to Margaret F. Fisher Howard in Nicholas County on October 17, 1861. Father of Ida M. Howard. Clerk in Nicholas County in 1860. Deputy clerk of the Nicholas Circuit Court in Carlisle, Kentucky, in 1861. Confirmed as a notary public in Nicholas County on February 5, 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, District 2, p. 392B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, Carlisle, District 1, p. 275.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, Carlisle, p. 276A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Nicholas County Marriages, Film #000252393, p. 344-45.
Find A Grave, "William W Howard (1836-1902)," Memorial #119972275, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/119972275 (accessed February 11, 2017).
KYR-0001-017-0062.
